    • Method Detail

      • split

        public static List<String> split(String text,
                                 char delimiter)
        Split the specified text in tokens based on the given delimiter.

        Some special cases:

        • Tokens can be in quotes, in case they can contain the delimiter
        • Quotes is pair of " or ' characters
        • Token in quotes can contain quote characters of the other type
        • Tokens are always trimmed unless they are in quotes
        • If delimiter is space, no empty tokens are returned (unless quoted)
        Examples: 
           "1 2 3 4"            split on ' ' gives "1","2","3","4"
   "   1  2  3 4  "     split on ' ' gives "1","2","3","4"
   "   '1 2' 3 '4 ' ''" split on ' ' gives "1 2","3","4 ",""
   "1 2 '3"' 4"         split on ' ' gives "1","2","3"","4"
   " "                  split on ' ' gives nothing
   ","                  split on ',' gives "",""
   "1,2,3,4"            split on ',' gives "1","2","3","4"
   "  1,  2,  3,  4 "   split on ',' gives "1","2","3","4"
   ",,1,2,,3,4,5,,"     split on ',' gives "","","1","2","","3","4","5","",""
        Issue: How to handle this case: 
           "1 2 '3''4' 5"  split on ' ' gives "1","2","34","5"
        Not sure what the optimal solution should be.

        Performace:

        For comma (or similar) delimited strings without quotes the String.split() method will behave slightly better (40%). For space delimited strings where "\\s+" is used to suppress additional whitespace, this method is about 3x faster. It is possible to use String.split() with regex to handle quotes, but it is slower, and it will leave the quotes in there so they must be removed afterwards.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to split. Non-null.
        delimiter - Delimiter character such as comma or space etc.
        Returns:
        The tokens of the text. Never null.

      • getNSignificantDigits

        public static int getNSignificantDigits(double magnitude,
                                        double step)
        Return the number of significant digits needed to properly represent values of regular data of the specified step and (maximum) magnitude.

        The intent is to find the correct number of significant digits in order to properly preserve the regularity of such numbers.

        Parameters:
        magnitude - Magnitude of the numbers in question. Typically the max value of the range.
        step - The regular step value.
        Returns:
        The requested number of significant digits. [0,>.

      • getSpaces

        public static String getSpaces(int n)
        Return a string containing the specified number of space characters.
        Parameters:
        n - Length of string to create.
        Returns:
        Requested string. If n is less than or equal to 0 an empty string is returned. Never null.

      • readContent

        public static byte[] readContent(File file,
                                 int nBytes)
        Read a portion of the specified file so it can be used for classifying the file by content.
        Parameters:
        file - File to read from. Non-null.
        nBytes - Number of bytes to read. About 2000 is fine for file classification.
        Returns:
        The portion read. Null if the read operation failed.
